name: agent-usage
title: Agent Usage
description: Monitor AI coding agent usage across Amp, Codex, Droid, Gemini, Kimi, Antigravity, and z.ai
author: thuggyduck

preferences.name: showAmp
preferences.title: Visible Agents
preferences.label: Show Amp
preferences.description: Show Amp usage in the list

preferences.name: showCodex
preferences.label: Show Codex
preferences.description: Show Codex usage in the list

preferences.name: showDroid
preferences.label: Show Droid
preferences.description: Show Droid usage in the list

preferences.name: showGemini
preferences.label: Show Gemini
preferences.description: Show Gemini usage in the list

preferences.name: showKimi
preferences.label: Show Kimi
preferences.description: Show Kimi usage in the list

preferences.name: showAntigravity
preferences.label: Show Antigravity
preferences.description: Show Antigravity usage in the list

preferences.name: showZai
preferences.label: Show z.ai
preferences.description: Show z.ai (GLM) usage in the list

preferences.name: ampDisplayMode
preferences.title: Amp Display Mode
preferences.description: Display Amp remaining as amount or percentage

preferences.name: codexAuthToken
preferences.title: Codex Authorization Token (Optional)
preferences.description: Optional fallback token. Usually auto-detected from ~/.codex/auth.json after 'codex login'. You can still paste Authorization header value ('Bearer eyJ...' or just 'eyJ...').

preferences.name: droidAuthToken
preferences.title: Droid Authorization Token
preferences.description: From browser DevTools: Authorization header when accessing https://app.factory.ai/settings/billing. Format: 'Bearer eyJ...' or just 'eyJ...'

preferences.name: kimiAuthToken
preferences.title: Kimi Authorization Token
preferences.description: From browser DevTools: Authorization header when accessing https://www.kimi.com/code/console. Format: 'Bearer eyJ...' or just 'eyJ...'

preferences.name: zaiApiToken
preferences.title: z.ai API Token
preferences.description: API token from z.ai platform. Set via extension preferences or Z_AI_API_KEY environment variable.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
